text: "Gold Digger" is a hip hop song from American rapper Kanye West. It has guest vocals by singer and actor Jamie Foxx. It was the second single off West's second studio album Late Registration (2005). The song hit #1 on the United States' Billboard Hot 100 on September 6, 2005. It was West's and Foxx's second #1 single. The song has samples of Ray Charles' 1954 hit song "I Got a Woman". At the 2006 Grammy Awards, "Gold Digger" was nominated for Record of the Year. It won the award for Best Rap Solo Performance. The song was #9 on the Billboard Hot 100 Songs of the Decade. ==Awards== Awards Year Organization Award Result Ref. 2005 Antville Music Video Awards Best Video Kiss Awards Most Wanted Download Vibe Awards Coolest Collabo 2006 BET Awards Video of the Year Best Collaboration Billboard R&B;/Hip-Hop Awards Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Song Hot Rap Track BMI R&B;/Hip-Hop Awards Award Winning Songs Grammy Awards Record of the Year Best Rap Solo Performance International Dance Music Awards Best Rap/Hip Hop Dance Track MP3.com Awards Best Single MTV Asia Awards Favorite Video MTV Australia Video Music Awards Best Male Video Best Hip-Hop Video Song of the Year MTV Video Music Awards Best Hip-Hop Video Best Male Video Ringtone of the Year MTV Video Music Awards Japan Best Hip-Hop Video MuchMusic Video Awards Best International Video People's Choice: Favorite International Video Soul Train Music Awards Video of the Year Best R&B;/Soul or Rap Dance Cut TEC Awards Record Production/Single or Track 2007 BMI Pop Awards Pop Awards 2010 Brit Awards Best Live Performance at the Brit Awards ==References== Category:Rap songs Category:Kanye West songs Category:2005 songs
title: Gold Digger (Kanye West song)
